body:
There isn't any server-side copy, but the other two have server support.

Also `SetModTime` should be implemented, if that is possible. The file PATCH function documentation states _"The allowed fields to updates are name, labels, description"_.
@klauspost my reading of that was that `SetModTime` wasn't possible, but if it is that would elevate ACD to first class supported file system.
"Mover" and "DirMover" are now in #721; this ticket should be for Copier" only.

[doc](https://developer.amazon.com/public/apis/experience/cloud-drive/content/nodes) -> Files -> Resource Model  indicates a file has a "parents" property which is "{String...} List of parent folder Ids.". Suggesting a File can have multiple parents. Is this a way to implement server side copy?

@E6L thanks for the note about the duplicate issue. 

Interesting idea about making multiple parents - yes that would make a copy sort of like taking a hard link in Unix. I wonder what delete does whether in would just remove one of the links - you'd probably have to unmatched it to delete a multiple linked file.

issue.title: Amazon drive - make it support Move and MoveDir

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Amazon Drive could support Move and MoveDir but doesn't at the moment.  This would use the PATCH calls for nodes and dirs.

I don't think Amazon Drive can support Copy thought.

issue.title: Sonarr + rclone + crypt + mount + ACD

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi,
I have mounted a ACD using rclone crypt mount. And using Sonarr to manage my Seasons collection. (Sonarr is pointed to mounted location)
After my torrent client download the file(Local). Sonarr tries to rename the file and move the file to my mounted location but it fails everytime.
In the logs I get the below:
2016/10/21 15:12:16 TV Shows/Vikings/Season 04/Vikings - 04x01 - A Good Treason - SDTV - x264 AAC.mp4.partial~: WriteFileHandle.Flush error: Post https://content-na.drive.amazonaws.com/cdproxy/nodes?suppress=deduplication: http: ContentLength=540 with Body length 390787417
2016/10/21 15:12:16 TV Shows/Vikings/Season 04/Vikings - 04x01 - A Good Treason - SDTV - x264 AAC.mp4.partial~: WriteFileHandle.Flush error: Attempt to use closed file handle
2016/10/21 15:12:16 TV Shows/Vikings/Season 04/Vikings - 04x01 - A Good Treason - SDTV - x264 AAC.mp4.partial~: Dir.Rename error: no such file or directory
2016/10/21 15:12:19 TV Shows/Vikings/Season 04/Vikings - 04x01 - A Good Treason - SDTV - x264 AAC.mp4.partial~: Dir.Remove error: no such file or directory

Seems like Sonarr tries to transfer the file in parts and thus causing some issue. 
I tried above setup by removing the crypt. But its causing the same error. 

Please let me know if you need any other logs.

Thanks

issue.title: Add support for server side move operations on ACD

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Depends on pull request at https://github.com/ncw/go-acd/pull/1 CI test is going to fail due to this.

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/795
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/830
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/809
Can be closed as a result of this pull request as well, although 830 also highlights an issue with overlapping not being prevented on crypted fs.

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/122
Can be updated

body:
implementing the `Copier` interface works as long as the file name is the same. All future renames will have to account for this and then maybe do an actual download+reupload to rename a "copy". I.e. this works differently from how hardlinks on POSIX filesystems work.

Also, to delete a file in multiple locations from one parent, you'd just have to remove that parent and leave the others. However, if you remove all parents from a file, it is instead attached to the _root_ of your ACD  regardless of where rclone's remote on ACD is located. I think the root folder id is then again present when you refresh the metadata, but I didn't check.

Either way, implementing a proper copy is going to be leaky into all sorts of other interfaces.
@breunigs Well spotted :-(  I think all those nasty corner cases make Copy impractical :-(  However Move is a very useful primitive.

issue.title: Mounting a wasabi bucket leads to Netdata reporting all 1BN inodes "in use"

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

A search on the forum suggests this may be the same issue as reported in 2018 (?) 

https://forum.rclone.org/t/inode-usage-maxed-out/4872


#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I have mounted a Wasabi bucket, and doing so causes my system to report all 1BN inodes as being used, Netdata is sending scary looking errors as a result. Things appear to be working, just, Netdata is having a fit.

![Screenshot 2024-09-26 at 11 53 33AM](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/303add18-e86b-4255-ae39-37ba83b2dc78)

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

I was on v1.53.3-DEV and immediately recognized that could be the issue, so I updated to v1.68.1 and the issue did not change.


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS (jammy), 64-bit
e.g.
Linux pyron 5.15.0-112-generic #122-Ubuntu SMP Thu May 23 07:48:21 UTC 2024 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Wasabi


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone mount truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai /mnt/truthcraft --daemon
`

tried variants like

`rclone mount truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai /mnt/truthcraft --daemon --attr-timeout 1h --dir-cache-time 1h --vfs-cache-mode full --stats 1s --vfs-read-chunk-size 1M --buffer-size 32M
`

and there is no change in behavior vis a vis inodes.

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
$ rclone mount truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai /mnt/truthcraft --daemon -vv
2024/09/26 18:44:53 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.68.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai" "/mnt/truthcraft" "--daemon" "-vv"]
2024/09/26 18:44:53 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai"
2024/09/26 18:44:53 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/ubuntu/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2024/09/26 18:44:53 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.68.1" finishing with parameters ["/usr/bin/rclone" "mount" "truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai" "/mnt/truthcraft" "--daemon" "-vv"]

ubuntu@pyron:~/truthcraft_mk2$ df -i /mnt/truthcraft
Filesystem                      Inodes IUsed      IFree IUse% Mounted on
truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai 1000000000     0 1000000000    0% /mnt/truthcraft

ubuntu@pyron:~/truthcraft_mk2$ sudo umount /mnt/truthcraft

ubuntu@pyron:~/truthcraft_mk2$ df -i /mnt/truthcraft
Filesystem       Inodes   IUsed    IFree IUse% Mounted on
/dev/md3       58466304 4174549 54291755    8% /

$ cat /home/ubuntu/.config/rclone/rclone.conf
[socialfoo]
type = s3
provider = Wasabi
env_auth = false
access_key_id = SECRET
secret_access_key = SECRET
region = us-central-1
endpoint = s3.us-central-1.wasabisys.com

[truthcraft-ai]
type = s3
provider = Wasabi
env_auth = false
access_key_id = SECRET
secret_access_key = SECRET
region = us-east-1
endpoint = s3.us-east-1.wasabisys.com
```

I note that the socialfoo mount point has been live for probably almost a year (whenever we installed 1.5.3DEV) and has never had any issues. I added the truthcraft mount point yesterday and the "billion inodes" problem started. The truthcraft-ai bucket is a new deploy and has only 17 files on it.

Here's some more log output that I think nails where the issue is coming from:

```
$ rclone mount truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai /mnt/truthcraft --daemon --log-file=/tmp/rclone-truthcraft.log --log-level DEBUG
ubuntu@pyron:~/truthcraft_mk2$ df -i /mnt/truthcraft
Filesystem                      Inodes      IUsed IFree IUse% Mounted on
truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai 1000000000 1000000000     0  100% /mnt/truthcraft
ubuntu@pyron:~/truthcraft_mk2$ cat /tmp/rclone-truthcraft.log
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.53.3-DEV" starting with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai" "/mnt/truthcraft" "--daemon" "--log-file=/tmp/rclone-truthcraft.log" "--log-level" "DEBUG"]
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai"
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/ubuntu/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.53.3-DEV" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai" "/mnt/truthcraft" "--daemon" "--log-file=/tmp/rclone-truthcraft.log" "--log-level" "DEBUG"]
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.53.3-DEV" starting with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai" "/mnt/truthcraft" "--daemon" "--log-file=/tmp/rclone-truthcraft.log" "--log-level" "DEBUG"]
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "truthcraft-ai:truthcraft-ai"
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/ubuntu/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2024/09/26 18:33:45 INFO  : S3 bucket truthcraft-ai: poll-interval is not supported by this remote
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : S3 bucket truthcraft-ai: Mounting on "/mnt/truthcraft"
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : : Root:
2024/09/26 18:33:45 DEBUG : : >Root: node=/, err=<nil>
2024/09/26 18:33:48 DEBUG : /: Attr:
2024/09/26 18:33:48 DEBUG : /: >Attr: attr=valid=1s ino=0 size=0 mode=drwxrwxr-x, err=<nil>
2024/09/26 18:33:48 DEBUG : : Statfs:
2024/09/26 18:33:48 DEBUG : : >Statfs: stat={Blocks:274877906944 Bfree:274877906944 Bavail:274877906944 Files:1000000000 Ffree:1000000000 Bsize:4096 Namelen:255 Frsize:4096}, err=<nil>

```

That statfs result appears to be radically bogus, I'd look there first... 


<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the  [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
